H0.text: They live in the same habitat and niche is the factor that determines whether two individuals are members of the same species.

H1.text: They forage and eat the same type of food is the factor that determines whether two individuals are members of the same species.

H2.text: They mate and produce fertile offspring is the factor that determines if two individuals are members of the same species.

H3.text: They are similar in appearance and color is the factor that determines if two individuals are members of the same species.

A4.text: A species... can be defined as the largest group of organisms in which any two individuals of the appropriate sexes or mating types can produce fertile offspring

A5.text: different phenotypes are not necessarily different species (e.g.
